seo_title: Korean ETF Real Cost Comparison | ISA, Pension Savings, IRP Guide
seo_description: Compare real costs of Korean-listed index ETFs (TER, other expenses, brokerage fees) and learn how to use ISA, Pension Savings, and IRP tax-advantaged accounts. Core information is available in 8 languages.
seo_keywords: Korean ETF comparison, ETF real cost, ISA, Pension Savings, IRP, Korean tax-advantaged account, S&P 500 ETF Korea, Nasdaq 100 ETF Korea, long-term investing
seo_jsonld_description: Multilingual finance service for comparing real costs of Korean-listed index ETFs and understanding ISA, Pension Savings, and IRP tax-advantaged account strategies.
home_subtitle: Compare the real costs of domestic-listed index ETFs that can be used in tax-saving accounts like ISA, Pension Savings, and IRP.

table_note:
* Data source: KOFIA Electronic Disclosure (Updated monthly)
* Real Cost = TER (Total Expense + Other Expenses) + Brokerage/Trading Fee Rate
pension_intro: Pension accounts are representative tax-saving accounts that receive powerful tax credit benefits during every year-end tax settlement while preparing funds for old age. We summarize the key contents of pension savings funds and IRP (Individual Retirement Pension) signed up at securities companies.
pension_h1: 1. Key Summary of Pension Accounts (As of 2026)
pension_limit_val2: 9 million KRW per year (Total including pension savings)
pension_assets_val2: Deposits, Funds, ETFs (30% mandatory in safe assets)
pension_receive_val1: After age 55 (Enrollment period 5 years or more)
pension_receive_val2: After age 55 (Enrollment period 5 years or more)
pension_withdraw_val2: Impossible (Only full termination possible except for legal reasons)
pension_rec1: Those who want stable retirement and a certain annual return (tax credit): Pension accounts are a necessity, not an option.
pension_rec2: Office workers with a large tax burden at year-end tax settlement: It is the most certain tool for those who want to reduce the tax they pay every year and receive refunds. When filling the 9 million KRW limit, you can get back up to 1.485 million KRW.
pension_rec3: Those who want to prepare long-term retirement funds: It is suitable for those who want to steadily accumulate for old age after 55, not money to spend right now. It has the effect of forcing savings while receiving benefits given by the state.
pension_rec4: Those who want to maximize the compound effect through tax deferral: Unlike general accounts, you do not pay dividend income tax (15.4%) every time, and you can pay at a low tax rate (3.3~5.5%) when you receive a pension later, so your investment principal grows faster.
pension_h3: 3. 3 Key Tax-Saving Benefits of Pension Accounts
pension_ben1: Tax Credit (Immediate Refund): You get back a certain percentage of the amount you saved immediately from that year's year-end tax settlement. It is essentially like an investment starting with a fixed rate of return.
pension_ben2: Tax Deferral (Pushing back the timing of tax payment): You do not pay tax right now on dividends or capital gains generated during the investment process. This money is reinvested, increasing the compound effect.
pension_ben3: Pension Income Tax (Low tax rate application): When you receive a pension later, you only need to pay a low pension income tax of 3.3~5.5% instead of 15.4% dividend income tax.
pension_h4: 4. Example of Tax Credit Benefit Experience (When paying 9 million KRW per year)
pension_ex_desc: This is the amount actually returned from year-end tax settlement according to the income level.
pension_ex1: Total salary 55 million KRW (Global income 45 million KRW) or less: Credit rate 16.5% ‚Üí 1,485,000 KRW refund
pension_ex2: Total salary 55 million KRW (Global income 45 million KRW) or more: Credit rate 13.2% ‚Üí 1,188,000 KRW refund
pension_h5: 5. Detailed Guide on Early Termination and Withdrawal
pension_wd_desc: Since pension accounts are long-term products, you should carefully check the conditions when finding money in the middle.
pension_wd1: Pension Savings Fund: Early withdrawal is relatively free. You can withdraw only a partial amount as needed without terminating the account. However, other income tax of 16.5% is imposed on the principal and operation income that received a tax credit. (Principal that did not receive a tax credit can be withdrawn without tax)
pension_wd2: IRP: In principle, partial withdrawal is impossible. Even if you want to pull only a part because of a sudden need for money, you must terminate the whole account. However, partial withdrawal is exceptionally allowed only when there are special reasons prescribed by law, such as a homelessness person's house purchase, lease deposit, medical treatment for 6 months or more, bankruptcy, etc.
pension_st1: Use of TDF (Target Date Fund): Management becomes easier if you choose a fund that automatically adjusts the ratio of risky and safe assets according to your retirement timing.
pension_st2: Dividend ETF Reinvestment: Dividends generated within the pension account are fully reinvested without tax, so it is the optimal account to hold dividend growth ETFs.
pension_st3: Rebalancing: Regularly check the ratio of assets, sell some profitable assets, and buy assets that have fallen to manage your rate of return.
pension_nt1: Tax Credit Refund Limit: Tax credit is a system that reduces the tax I have to pay (determined tax). If the determined tax is 0 KRW or less than the credit amount, no additional refund occurs.
pension_nt2: Investment Loss Risk: Investment products such as funds and ETFs have a risk of principal loss.
pension_nt3: Pension Receipt Limit: If the annual receipt amount exceeds 15 million KRW, you must choose global taxation or separate taxation (16.5%), so you should plan your receipt well.
isa_title: üìà ISA (Individual Savings Account) Brokerage Type Guide
isa_intro: ISA is an all-around tax-saving pocket that manages various financial products such as stocks, ETFs, and deposits in one account and receives tax benefits. We summarize the key standards applied as of 2026.
isa_target_val: General type (man 19 years old or older resident), Farmers type (earned income 50 million KRW or less, etc.)
isa_limit_val: 20 million KRW (Max 5 years, total 100 million KRW)
isa_taxfree_val: 2 million KRW (General type), 4 million KRW (Farmers type)
isa_rec1: Those who plan to use a large sum within 3~5 years: It is suitable for preparing short/medium-term purpose funds such as marriage funds and house preparation. You only need to fulfill the duty participation period of 3 years.
isa_rec2: Those who have filled the pension savings account limit: It is the best alternative when you need additional tax-saving means after filling the pension savings/IRP limit. Additional tax credit is also possible when switching maturity funds to a pension account.
isa_rec3: Those who want to manage dividend income and tax: You can save 15.4% dividend income tax when investing in domestic dividend stocks or domestic-listed overseas ETFs.
isa_ben1: Profit and Loss Offsetting: Taxes are levied only on net income by summing profit and loss. (Very advantageous compared to general accounts)
isa_ben2: Tax-free Benefit: 0 KRW tax on net income up to 2 million KRW (General type) or 4 million KRW (Farmers type)!
isa_ben3: Low-rate Separate Taxation (9.9%): A low tax rate of 9.9% is applied to excess profit beyond the tax-free limit, and it is not included in global financial income taxation.
isa_h4: 4. Tax-free Benefit Experience Example (When 10 million KRW profit occurs)
isa_ex_desc: Assumption of 10 million KRW profit generated from domestic-listed overseas ETF investment:
isa_ex1: General Account: Tax of 1.54 million KRW (Actual receipt 8.46 million KRW)
isa_ex2: ISA General Type: Tax of 0.792 million KRW (Saved about 0.75 million KRW)
isa_ex3: ISA Farmers Type: Tax of 0.594 million KRW (Saved about 0.95 million KRW)
isa_h5: 5. Choosing an ISA Type that Suits You
isa_type1: Brokerage Type (Most Recommended): The method where investors directly trade domestic stocks or ETFs. It is most advantageous when parallelizing stock investment.
isa_type2: Trust Type: Deposits or funds focus, giving operation instructions to financial companies.
isa_type3: Discretionary Type: The method where a financial company builds a portfolio and operates it.
isa_st1: Including Domestic-listed Overseas ETFs: Dividend income tax reduction effect is large when operating overseas index ETFs such as S&P500 and Nasdaq 100.
isa_st2: Utilizing Payment Limit Carryover: If you do not fill this year's limit, it can be carried over to next year (up to 100 million KRW in total).
isa_st3: Pension Conversion of Maturity Funds: Additional tax credit of 10% (max 3 million KRW) of the transfer amount when transferring to a pension account after 3 years of maturity.
isa_qa1:
Q. Do I have to terminate unconditionally after 3 years?
A. No. You can extend the maturity and continue to invest.
isa_qa2:
Q. Is there a tax benefit for stock loss too?
A. Yes. It is deducted from other income (dividends, etc.) by the stock loss amount, reducing the overall tax.
isa_qa3:
Q. Can I pull money in the middle if it is urgent?
A. You can withdraw freely anytime within the principal paid. (Termination is required for withdrawing profits)
isa_nt1: Investment Loss Risk: There is a possibility of principal loss.
isa_nt2: 1 Person 1 Account: Only one can be opened across the entire financial sector.
isa_nt3: Sign-up Restriction for Global Financial Income Taxpayers: Those who fall under it more than once during the last 3 years cannot sign up.
guide_h1: "Investment is ultimately a battle against cost"
guide_start: üí° Start of Service: John Bogle's Philosophy
guide_text1:
John Bogle, the founder of the index fund, said. "Investment is ultimately a battle against cost."
For comfortable long-term investment, index funds (ETFs) are the best tool. However, what we tend to overlook is the 'hidden cost'.
guide_text2:
Domestic securities companies and operators do not reveal all the costs involved in operating ETFs in an easy-to-see glance.
In order for general investors to know the exact cost, there was a nuisance that they had to download an Excel file from the KOFIA every time, search for unfamiliar standard codes, and contrast the total expense, other expenses, and brokerage/trading fees as of the end of last month one by one.
guide_text3: We intend to solve this inconvenience. etfsave.life automatically collects complex data so that anyone can quickly and easily check the 'real cost' that investors will actually bear.
guide_text4: This site is a 'self-investment guide' where investors can search for ETFs directly and compare their costs. The provided information is based on objective data, but the final investment judgment must be made through the investor's own careful review.
guide_click_code: Clicking on the symbol copies the symbol to the clipboard so you can easily search on securities company apps or HTS. Clicking on the name takes you to the corresponding stock details page on Naver Finance. on this stock page, you can check AUM, trading volume, tracking error, etc. mentioned below.
guide_ref: üìä Please refer to it when using
guide_ref_text: Of course, cost is not everything about a good ETF.
guide_ref1: AUM (Asset Under Management Size): You should check if the fund's size is stable.
guide_ref2: Trading Volume: Liquidity that you can buy and sell whenever you want is important.
guide_ref3: Tracking Error: You should also look at how well it follows the underlying index.
guide_ref_closing: But for 'installment long-term investors' who steadily collect without selling, cost is one of the most decisive factors determining the rate of return.
guide_cheer_text:
We hope the data provided by this site will be a small help in protecting your precious assets and making wiser investment decisions.
Beyond the barrier of cost, we will walk the path of unwavering long-term investment together.
fomo_intro: Do not be anxious about others' profit. Investment is a battle with yourself.
fomo_h1: 1. The Reality of the Fear of 'Sudden Poverty'
fomo_text1: 'Sudden poverty' is a neologism started from relative deprivation. When the asset value of others rises and my asset is the same, you feel like you have lost, but this is because the target of comparison was set incorrectly.
fomo_text2: The purpose of investment should not be to become richer than others, but to secure the funds necessary for my life cycle safely. You must keep in mind that others' rate of return is irrelevant to the value of my life.
fomo_h2: 2. What we cannot see: Survivorship bias
fomo_text3: Success stories exposed to the outside are likely cases of one or two out of tens of thousands. This is called survivorship bias.
fomo_case:
Example: Lottery winner interview
We watch interviews of lottery winners on TV and have hope that I can also win. However, millions of losers who failed to win are silent behind it. The investment market is the same. People who lost all their assets due to high-risk investment do not speak out. You must see the possibility of numerous failures hidden behind a single colorful success.
fomo_h3: 3. Risk of Volatility seen through real cases
fomo_risk1:
Example 1: 2022 LUNA Incident
Luna, which was highlighted as an algorithmic stable coin, plunged 99% in value overnight. Assets of hundreds of millions of won converged to 0 won in just a few days, and many investors suffered irreparable damage. It is a representative case showing that unbearable risk of destruction always lurks behind high profit.
fomo_risk2:
Example 2: Meme Stock Fever
Stocks that soared following trends in certain online communities plummeted miserably after a colorful rise. Individual investors who entered at the end of Information catch the top, which results in the loss of long-term investment motivation.
fomo_h4: 4. Guarding against sweet talk and fraud methods
fomo_scam: Words that you can make big money easily are fraud or dangerous gambling in nine cases out of ten.
fomo_scam1: High profit guarantee: You should suspect words that deterministically guarantee profit that overwhelmingly exceeds the market average rate of return.
fomo_scam2: Short-term big break temptation: Stocks recommended by reading rooms or unverified experts are highly likely to be in a state where stock prices have already risen or are operation stocks.
fomo_h5: 5. How to stay in the market and experience the flow
fomo_stay: Give up the impatience and stay in the market, which is eventually the way to win.
fomo_stay1: Maintaining your own speed: If others run and you run without preparation, you will fall. Continue saving and investing that fits your income level and fund plan.
fomo_stay2: Making time your side: The magic of compound interest comes from waiting, not impatience. Rather than trying to reverse life in 1-2 years, aim for peace after 10-20 years.
fomo_stay3: Experiencing with small amounts: If investment study is needed, it is important to start with a very small amount that you can afford and experience the physiology of the market yourself.
fomo_concl: Investment is not a game of winning over others, but a game of controlling my own desires. When you close your ears to the noise of the market and focus on your principles, true asset growth finally begins.
